sentences.english: The old organ wheezed out a tune.
sentences.chinese: 那架老风琴呜呜地奏出曲子。

sentences.english: He sensed my unhappiness and started whining.
sentences.chinese: 它感觉到了我的不开心，开始发出呜呜声。

sentences.english: Wu said she makes just a few cents on each one.
sentences.chinese: 吴女士说她从每个呜呜祖啦上仅仅赚几美分。

sentences.english: Annoyed by vuvuzelas at the World Cup?
sentences.chinese: 世界杯赛场上的呜呜祖拉惹人厌？
船上的浓雾号角发出呜呜声。

sentences.english: The engine gave short calls with its whistle, and frequently the bell rang.
sentences.chinese: 机车的汽笛发出短促的呜呜声，车铃也不时地响着。

sentences.english: When robert learned the bad news, he sat down and started to blubber .
sentences.chinese: 罗拔听说那个坏消息后，坐下来开始呜呜地哭出来。

sentences.english: I broke out crying and sobbing.
sentences.chinese: 我不由得呜呜咽咽地哭起来。
船上的浓雾信号角发出呜呜声。

sentences.english: The kettle was singing (away) on the cooker.
sentences.chinese: 水壶在炉子上发出呜呜声。

sentences.english: Every cat fancier has seen their pet purring in happiness;
sentences.chinese: 每一个爱猫的人都认为呜呜声是猫快乐时的表现。

sentences.english: The big car purred along the road .
sentences.chinese: 那辆大汽车一路呜呜地开了过去。

sentences.english: Wang Yaner spit water woke up and began to cry.
sentences.chinese: 王燕儿吐着水醒了过来，呜呜地哭了起来。

sentences.english: A little child bleated in the cold.
sentences.chinese: 一个小孩在寒冷中呜呜地叫。

sentences.english: Maybe that explains why some people can't stand the vuvuzela.
sentences.chinese: 也许这就是一些人受不了呜呜祖拉的原因吧。

definition: to cry out/to bark out a sound
(onom.) sound of the wind or the breathing of sb who is sound asleep
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
hiss/neigh/Ss! (sound of air sucked between the teeth, indicating hesitation or thinking over)
